text:
So I am getting an Server error 500 since last week when I try to check the dev. info:
`{{ domain }}/__context__/{{ slug }}?portalId={{portalId}}&access_token={{acctess_token }}`

and apparently <@U22PWJ41G> is unable to log in:
`<https://app.HubSpot.com/content/api/v4/tools-menu/template-context-redirect?portalId=>{{ portalID }}&url={{ url }}`

Any HS engineer that can help me?

I uploaded a file via ftp and hs created a duplicate folder with underscores for spaces. The original folder (without underscores in hs) displayed in cyberduck with underscores for spaces. This sounds more confusing than it really is lol.

Is there a way to prevent this or is this a bug?
Where can I find the newest mobile menu guide for HubSpot?

Hello,
why related post not show results with hubl ?

For all the HubSpot Developers out there in the Chicagoland area (or even if you are going to be in the area on June 20th, 2018) I would like to extend to you the opportunity to attend the first Chicago HubSpot User Groups Developer Focused HUG event with special guest, the ever incredibly talented <@U6GNQ7JBU>! 

Date: June 20th, 2018
Time: 6:00PM - 7:15PM
Location: Solemn Oath Brewery, Naperville, IL 
_[I'll finally be able to buy Matt that beer(s) that is long overdue]_

There are only ~20 spots left to sign up and developers will be getting top priority for spots.

Sign up is below:
<http://chicago.HubSpotusergroups.com/register-for-june-2018-hug-matt-coley-the-need-for-speed>
so how many hugs are we expecting Matt to get. XD
Depends on how many beers people drink, i'll try and keep a running tally
thanks for leading the session! Any way to record and share for us not in Chicago area :slightly_smiling_face:
lollol <@U7SL518D6>
I'll run it past the HUG leaders and see
Signed up, with the longest Job Title youâ€™ve ever seen

Hey all --- just a heads up that the new design manager is now available to ALL . You'll still have the option to toggle back and forth between the old and the new design manager over the coming months, but you'll now have access to the new tools in any portals you manage. If you have clients that are seeing the new design manager in their portal, and are looking to get caught up to speed on the new tool, feel free to pass along our design manager training <https://rise.articulate.com/share/gL5qPg4wopTBJTJMOQKYrdOoKKbZ8nnA#/?_k=ih8o5o>
lol just read it, that is an amazing title
we'll have to grab some beers and chat for sure

Anyone have any clever solutions for setting the contact owner on new contacts programmatically based off of which page they fill out a form on? I have ~60 potential owners and am trying to avoid solutions that involve 60 forms or 60 workflows.
Just signed up!

For the HTML module in the marketplace, can you use HubL in it? I am assuming no but I think the generic HubL module may still be of benefit because of things like adding a page title (on page not meta) programmatically. I can totally just make a CM but for something super simply like this a general HubL module seems faster/easier.
<@U22PWJ41G> do you happen to know?
The HTML module validates against hubl and prints it as rich text. All HubL should be used within a module
Sounds good, ill stick to using CM's. Thanks <@U22PWJ41G>
No problem!
HI Friends! :wave: Need your amazing ideas :bulb:

We're thinking of possibly doing a "Developer Day-style" event at INBOUND18. :smiley:  WOOT:smiley: Once we have the event confirmed, we will let everyone know details ASAP to help with travel planning. BUT - to help scope the event, I need your help answering:
> :point_right:  What sessions/workshops would you put on the schedule - what format - and why?

HubSpot Beta's - What's available and why you should try them today. 
I know there are a lot of Beta's out there that some people may not know about. Like when search started and even when DMv2 was starting out. I think it would be nice to have a session discussing what all the beta are that are available from the CMS standpoint and how we can go about helping to contribute to them

awesome topic <@U2H3TT8F2> :slightly_smiling_face: (we can, and will, improve on this in general too). 

What else... keep them coming folks
Not exactly sure of what the format would be, but some opportunity to meet/chat with other devs and possibly compare notes on development practices/workflows
<@UAZCZ3HMW> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/UAZCZ3HMW/FB52FM6NM/image.png|hello, how to create a quiz>
how that
You can create fields that populate analogues on a hidden HubSpot form and cram the whole thing into something like fullpage.js
<@UAZCZ3HMW> That particular form is built using slick slider and is built in a custom html widget. If you check the source you can see how it was constructed.
^ the more meeting and comparing notes the better! :slightly_smiling_face: Any ideas on format for that <@U54TVT3C1>? Have you been at any events that have done that well in the past?

I know this isn't too helpful... but not really.  

I found last year's partner day fairly helpful.  Made some good connections at lunch.  It would be nice if it was something casual like that.  The comparing notes part has mostly come through conversations/communications after the fact

Ok something that has Irked me since the beginning of time is the "Header" HS Module. Why is there not a selection on the page editor to choose which header style it is (h1, h2, h3) yet you can in the DM when adding to a page?
<@U2H3TT8F2> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2H3TT8F2/FB6MJ3YQP/image.png|image.png>
Makes using it in Flexible Columns totally pointless
Same with Section Header
I actually second that. It's always been annoying for me.
I assume it's so you can really restrict the editor side to just one style for the end-user... but it ends up being a bit more confusing.
